features: Dominoes Double 6 | Your Double 6 Dominoes Game comes complete with 28 high quality domino pieces and is the perfect beginner double dominoes for children and adults alike.
Play For Generations | Our club standard double six dominoes game is ideal for beginners or experts. Family board games for players of all ages.
Play & Learn | Dominoes Games provide wonderful learning experiences, whether experienced or starting anew. Each dominoes set allows for learning of basic numerics and competitive play.
Classic Dominoes | This dominoes game set has the correct domino brass spinners. All dominoes club standard tiles are fitted with lovely brass spinners for super-fast shuffling.

1st Class Quality | Our dominoes sets for adults and kids are presented in a wooden slide lid box with our beautiful Jaques branded gift box finished with the exquisite detail of individually hand tied bows.
description: Product Description Our set of Club Standard Premium Double Six Dominoes is presented in a handmade slide lid wooden case. This premium Club Set includes a full set of 28 hand painted dominoes. Slid Lid Case: 18.5cm x 6.5cm x 5.3cm Dominoes: 49mm x 24mm x 9mm REGULATION THICKNESS DOMINOES Premium Set for Adults Complete, with Complete set of 28 luxury Double 6 Dominoes. DOMINOES FOR CHILDREN 's BRAIN TRAINING Great learning resource Develops Numeracy skills Develops pattern recognition Sensory Development LUXURY GIFT PRESENTATION DOMINOS SET - Presented in a Wooden Slide Lid Box with Beautiful Jaques Branding PERFECT GIFT -This Dominoes Set is Packed with signature Jaques 'Historical Tissue Paper' and Wrapped with a Luxury Jaques Branded Ribbon WHY BUY JAQUES? English Quality - Handmade by Jaques of London - Since 1795. Over 200 years of Exceptional Quality Service. Regulation Thickness Dominoes Dominoes for Children's Brain Training Luxury Gift Why Buy Jaques Buying a bit of Dominoes History Dominoes are the small tiles historically carved from bone or ivory and featuring small round pips of inset ivory that collectively made up the early domino sets.A game with ancient roots, the oldest known sets date back to c.1120 A.D. in China, and it is thought that they were introduced to China from India before that. Playing and Learning with Dominoes "Creativity can solve almost any problem" Playing and Learning with Puzzles PL AY i s the WO RK o f CH ILDHOOD a nd the highest form of RE SEARCH Playing and Learning with Puzzles "children must be taught how to think not what to think" Playing and Learning with Puzzles " A Child's SELF-ESTEEM starts at HOME" Creative thinking Increased Abilities Motor Skills Self Esteem War Time Jaques 1939 - during the Second World War Jaques’ craftsmen are recruited by MI9 to design and produce ‘escape and evasion kits’ by concealing tools etc within games to help Allied prisoners of war escape. Maps are hidden between the cardboard of Jaques Ludo or Snakes and Ladders boards; precious currency is secreted, tightly furled in the wooden handle of a cleverly split Jaques Lacing Awl, Even the pegs of Jaques' Deck Quoits are hollowed out so that a tiny working compass can be hidden in them. Inventors of many cherished family games Staunton chess set Snakes and Ladders Ludo Ping pong Tiddly Winks Jaques of London Our History In 1795 The company was established by a country boy named Thomas a farmer’s son. The first of an unbroken line of eight generations to make indoor and outdoor games.In 1851 John Jaques II wins a place in sporting history and a Gold Medal for introducing Croquet into England at the Great Exhibition of 1851.More than 200 years on, the 7th generation of the Jaques family look with confidence to the future, knowing they continue to be in a unique position to teach the world to play. Teaching the world to play since 1795 Jaques today remains a family company, owned and operated by direct descents of the founder John Jaques. Many of our games are lovingly crafted by hand in our UK based workshop.
